description: From sense +‎ -less. Compare Saterland Frisian sinloos (“senseless, foolish”).

adjectives.description: senseless (comparative more senseless, superlative most senseless)

entries.meaning: Without feeling or consciousness; deprived of sensation.
examples: The blow to his head rendered him senseless, he didn't awaken until he was in the ambulance.

entries.meaning: Lacking meaning or purpose; without common sense.
examples: What a senseless waste of money.

entries.meaning: Without a discernible meaning or purpose, especially of a violent or evil act.
examples: The school shooting was a senseless act of violence.

entries.meaning: Without consideration, awareness or sound judgement
examples: He took senseless risks, not even aware of the danger he was in.
